reviews.review_msg: The best prof in the SFU Polisci department.

Dr. Ayers is an amazing professor, who understands the material inside out and is interested in the student thinking critically on the topics covered each week. She cares for the student's learning process and uses all types of pedagogic tools for the student to grasp the concepts. SFU is lucky to have her and I am lucky to have her as a Prof.

Alison is an excellent professor that struck an excellent balance between lecture, discussion, and multimedia in her seminar.  I honestly learned more in her class than any other class I've taken.  Taking her course has led me to consider a masters in GPE, which was not on my radar before.  Discussion was always relevant and concise.

Alison herself is a great lecturer but she did little to control our seminar.  People went off topic for an hour on things that had nothing to do with the material and she did nothing to bring the discussion back to the material I paid to learn.

Best teacher ever! The classes are like a seminar, and keeps students engaged all the time. The readings are mind blowing and life changing. She is very unique and original in thoughts, organization and materials. This class is a must! Thank you, Alison!

Brilliant Prof.! By far the best professor I have ever had. Her lectures are engaging, the material she provides is thought provoking and opens new mental horizons, and her teaching style/ability is second to none. I will even go as far as saying that her class can be life altering, so def. if you can, take her class!
Alison is very knowledgeable in the field of GPE/IPE.  She puts a lot of effort into the preparation for her courses.  My only criticism is that she does not control her seminar very well.
She is biased in her teaching indeed.  She only interjected in the seminar to express her marxist persuasions.  The course  definitely needs some more balance.  An extremely friendly woman.

Alison was absolutely incredible. While I'll agree with other comments about the heavy workload, at the same time the course content helped make this class excellent and it is well worth spending time on. This is one of those classes that deeply change your perspective on the world and forever stay in your mind.

Ayers is by far the best prof I have had at SFU. The course covers a wide range of readings, from conservative  to radical. This course really opened my eyes and covers a much broader range of perspectives than any course at SFU. Highly recommended for students who want to broaden their perspective. SFU needs more profs like Ayers.

The BEST professor in the department, and the highlight of my BA degree at SFU.By introducing the various theoretical perspectives in the discipline and encouraging in-class debate and analysis, her teaching style fosters intellectual growth, and a well-rounded understanding of issues. Ayers is passionate, committed, fair, and extremely insightful.

Re: Supposed "bias." In no other class have I ever read such a variety of thinkers: from Smith to Hayek to Friedman to Marx to Lenin and everything in between. It's called education and it usually involves something other than just having your existing biases confirmed. There is no prof at SFU that is as fair to as many differing views as Ayers.

Honestly the BEST class I have ever taken. Students read and learn about the mainstream pol-econ theories/theorists for more than half the course, then critical perspectives are introduced, allowing the student to come to their own conclusions. I have never seen students so vibrant and inspired. Best professor I have ever had, NO question!
Best instructor in the department.  Excellent class, Informative readings, TAKE THIS CLASS!

One of the most engaging and insightful classes!  The seminar notes and docs were an excellent way of working through course material.  They facilitated great discussions and were a good way to get to know other students, making class actually fun! Alison is super  nice and helpful, and obviously brilliant.  Truly one of the BEST profs at SFU!

I can honestly say she is the most inspiring professor I have ever had, definitely a breath of fresh air to have someone so critical in our poli-sci dept. However, she is so friendly, kind and accessible to her students that regardless of your political leanings you will adore her.

Brilliant Professor--in every sense of the word. Respectful of your opinions, but challenges you intellectually and academically. Everything one could hope for from an educator. The level of discussion in this class, quality wise, was second to none. 
 
 The best class I took in my 4 years at SFU, full stop.
I agree she is critical but she is not fair to other perspectives, not at all.  She is a tough marker in general but god forbid you lean slightly to the right.

She is extremely hard and demands a lot of your time.  The readings are very extensive and there are weekly assignments.  Mind you, you will be spending hours a week copying reserves and finding articles, on top of the text books you purchase.  Absolutely ridiculous.  I'm an A student and she gave me my first B-.
She is very subtle and softspoken. I loved her though, she opened new doors of understanding to me. Made Political economy understandable.

Tough class if no background in philosophy or theory. Ayers is great however and can explain complex theory so that undergrads can get it. She is critical, but also very fair to traditions she doesn't agree with. Every POL SCI student should have to take this course!
No Comments
tough class in general
